<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 276, 230, 292]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 277, 905, 292]]<|/det|>
9709/42  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 301, 240, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 4 Mechanics  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[780, 301, 905, 316]]<|/det|>
May/June 2024  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 325, 905, 341]]<|/det|>
1 hour 15 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 371]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 392, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 222, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 275, 450]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 450, 760, 466]]<|/det|>
Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 806, 482]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 482, 562, 497]]<|/det|>
Write your answer to each question in the space provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 498, 480, 512]]<|/det|>
Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 359, 527]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 868, 559]]<|/det|>
If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 560, 485, 574]]<|/det|>
You should use a calculator where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 880, 605]]<|/det|>
You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 606, 856, 636]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 636, 777, 652]]<|/det|>
Where a numerical value for the acceleration due to gravity \((g)\) is needed, use \(10 \text{m} \text{s}^{- 2}\) .  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 681, 213, 695]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 697, 384, 712]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 50.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 712, 728, 728]]<|/det|>
The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 72, 94, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
A cyclist and bicycle have a total mass of \(72\mathrm{kg}\). The cyclist rides along a horizontal road against a total resistance force of \(28\mathrm{N}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 117, 920, 152]]<|/det|>
Find the total work done by the cyclist to increase his speed from \(8\mathrm{m s}^{-1}\) to \(16\mathrm{m s}^{-1}\) while travelling a distance of 100 metres.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 134, 920, 153]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 72, 92, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
A particle \(P\) moves in a straight line. At time \(t\)s after leaving a point \(O\) on the line, \(P\) has velocity \(\nu \mathrm{m}\mathrm{s}^{- 1}\) , where \(\nu = 44t - 6t^{2} - 36\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 120, 144, 138]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 120, 764, 139]]<|/det|>
Find the set of values of \(t\) for which the acceleration of the particle is positive.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 120, 920, 139]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 400, 186, 419]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 400, 534, 419]]<|/det|>
Find the two values of \(t\) at which \(P\) returns to \(O\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 400, 920, 419]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 94, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[304, 79, 692, 327]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 344, 920, 378]]<|/det|>
Four coplanar forces of magnitude \(P\mathrm{N}\), \(10\mathrm{N}\), \(16\mathrm{N}\) and \(2\mathrm{N}\) act at a point in the directions shown in the diagram. It is given that the forces are in equilibrium.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 390, 331, 408]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(\theta\) and \(P\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 390, 920, 408]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 94, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 920, 111]]<|/det|>
A car has mass \(1400\mathrm{kg}\). When the speed of the car is \(\nu \mathrm{m}\mathrm{s}^{- 1}\) the magnitude of the resistance to motion is \(k\nu^2\mathrm{N}\) where \(k\) is a constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 121, 144, 140]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 121, 920, 157]]<|/det|>
The car moves at a constant speed of \(24\mathrm{m}\mathrm{s}^{- 1}\) up a hill inclined at an angle of \(\alpha\) to the horizontal where \(\sin \alpha = 0.12\) . At this speed the magnitude of the resistance to motion is \(480\mathrm{N}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 168, 181, 186]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 168, 348, 186]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(k\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 168, 920, 186]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 322, 180, 341]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 322, 468, 341]]<|/det|>
Find the power of the car's engine.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 322, 920, 341]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 94, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[272, 79, 724, 272]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 282, 920, 348]]<|/det|>
A particle of mass \(0.8\mathrm{kg}\) lies on a rough plane which is inclined at an angle of \(28^{\circ}\) to the horizontal. The particle is kept in equilibrium by a force of magnitude \(T\mathrm{N}\). This force acts at an angle of \(35^{\circ}\) above a line of greatest slope of the plane (see diagram). The coefficient of friction between the particle and the plane is 0.2 .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 359, 489, 378]]<|/det|>
Find the least and greatest possible values of \(T\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 359, 920, 378]]<|/det|>
<mark>[8]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 94, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 920, 153]]<|/det|>
Three particles \(A, B\) and \(C\) of masses \(5 \text{kg}, 1 \text{kg}\) and \(2 \text{kg}\) respectively lie at rest in that order on a straight smooth horizontal track \(XYZ\). Initially \(A\) is at \(X, B\) is at \(Y\) and \(C\) is at \(Z\). Particle \(A\) is projected towards \(B\) with a speed of \(6 \text{m s}^{-1}\) and at the same instant \(C\) is projected towards \(B\) with a speed of \(v \text{m s}^{-1}\). In the subsequent motion, \(A\) collides and coalesces with \(B\) to form particle \(D\). Particle \(D\) then collides and coalesces with \(C\) to form particle \(E\) and \(E\) moves towards \(Z\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 178, 144, 197]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 175, 678, 198]]<|/det|>
Show that after the second collision the speed of \(E\) is \(\frac{15 - \nu}{4} \mathrm{m s}^{-1}\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 180, 918, 198]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 549, 181, 567]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 549, 759, 570]]<|/det|>
The total loss of kinetic energy of the system due to the two collisions is \(63 \mathrm{~J}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 581, 490, 600]]<|/det|>
Use the result from **(a)** to show that \(\nu = 3\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 581, 920, 600]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 148, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 920, 104]]<|/det|>
Use an energy method to find the speed of the particles at the instant when they are at the same vertical height.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 85, 920, 103]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]
